benchmark_details.name: VideoGameQA-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: VideoGameQA-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate vision-language models (VLMs) specifically for video game quality assurance (QA) tasks, including visual unit testing, visual regression testing, glitch detection, and bug report generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized benchmark for evaluating the performance of vision-language models in various video game quality assurance tasks.

data.source: Real-world gameplay images from Steam and gameplay videos from YouTube, combined with synthetic samples generated using the Unity game engine.
data.size: 4,786 samples consisting of 2,236 image-based samples and 1,200 video-based samples
data.annotation: Manual annotation and verification of collected samples by researchers

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model outputs against ground truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in detecting glitches or errors in video game QA tasks.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated on diverse tasks including visual unit tests, UI validation, and glitch detection
